The Messenger of Sseth was a powerful enchanted Ssethssar longbow.
The Messenger of Sseth was visually distinct. The bows grip was banded with red and black â€“ colors of the yuan-ti archer Apalis pious priest family. The bows ends were carved to depict snake heads, symbolizing the yuan-ti deity Sseth.
The longbow was a powerful +2 enchanted weapon that allowed the wielder to launch three arrows per six seconds.
This bow was crafted thousands of years before the , by a warm-blood hater named Apali. The yuan-ti was a powerful and long-living archer who slew countless men, women, and children with the Messenger of Sseth over the course of several centuries he lived through. Apali was killed in Chessenta by a cleric of Assuran in revenge for the murder of the clerics great-grandparent in Chult a century earlier.
The bow changed hands until it reached the Dragons Eye on the Spine of the World. In 1281 DR, the Messenger of Sseth was wielded by a yuan-ti High Archer in service of a marilith Yxunomei.
